Metaphone 3 Toolkit
Class scoredHomeophone

   in ScoredHomeophone.h
class scoredHomeophone

The scoredHomeophone class is a data class designed to wrap a word which is a homeophone of the initial search string, its edit distance (Levenshtein distance) score from this initial search string, and a definition, if any.

Constructor Summary
scoredHomeophone( int inScore, char* inWord )
          Paramertized constructor initialized with Levenshtein distance score, and the word in question.

Constructor Detail

scoredHomeophone

public scoredHomeophone( int inScore, char* inWord );
Paramertized constructor initialized with Levenshtein distance score, and the word in question.
Parameters:
inScore - The Levenshtein distance score from the initial search string.
inWord - A character pointer to the homeophone of the original search string.

Method Detail

getDefinition

public const char* getDefinition();
Retrieve a pointer to the character string storing the definition of the word.
Returns:
a character pointer to the definition of the word in question. if WordNet has not supplied a definition, a null string will be returned.

getScore

public int getScore();
Retrieve the Levenshtein distance score.
Returns:
an integer representing the Levenshtein distance between this word and the search string.

getString

public string getString();
Retrieve the word as a std::string object.
Returns:
a reference to the string object containing the word stored in this object.

getWord

public const char* getWord();
Retrieve the word as a pointer to a character string.
Returns:
a character pointer to the word stored in this object.

operator<

public bool operator<( const scoredHomeophone& rhs ) const;
Comparison operator required for objects which are to be stored in sorted order in collection objects. This class is sorted by Levenshtein distance score.
Parameters:
Returns:
true if the Levenshtein distance of the object on the right hand side of the operator is less than the Levenshtein distance of the object on the left.

setDefinition

public void setDefinition( char* inDefinition );
Store the definition of the word.
Parameters:
a - character pointer to the definition of the word.

setScore

public void setScore( int inScore );
Set the Levenshtein distance score.
Parameters:
an - integer representing the Levenshtein distance between this word and the search string.
